description: Walking Spleenwort (Asplenium ebenoides) is an amazing plant species! This perennial evergreen fern is found in mountainous regions and cliffs on every continent except Antarctica. It has slender, light green leaves that are lance-shaped with a ribbed texture. As its name suggests, this species is known to "walk" due to its rhizomes that extend horizontally across rock surfaces. Its small, yellow-green spores form unusual, lacy patterns on the undersides of their leaves. This plant is an excellent choice for vertical gardens, moss walls, and various rock-crevices as it can be tough and low-maintenance. With its unique and beautiful form, this versatile species is a great addition to any garden!
